title: Rara Mutton Recipe
author: NDTV Food
description: This Himachali dish is popularly enjoyed during special events and festive occasions. Prepared with a mélange of classic Indian spices, this soulful red mutton curry shall make your mouth water.

recipe_directions.1: To begin making the Himachali Mutton Rara recipe, In a wide pan, dry roast all the garam masala ingredients except the nutmeg and grind them into a powder using a mixer grinder
recipe_directions.2: Mix nutmeg powder in this mixture and keep it aside. Heat mustard oil in a heavy bottomed pan to smoking point and cumin seeds
recipe_directions.3: Add chopped onion, green chillies, garlic and ginger and saute for 10 minutes
recipe_directions.4: Add red chilli powder, turmeric powder and mix it properly. Add tomatoes,salt and sugar
recipe_directions.5: Let it cook for 15 to 20 minutes on medium flame till tomatoes are soft and the oil has risen to the top. Sprinkle little water. Now mix mutton and let it cook for 20 to 25 minutes till it is rich and fully coated with all spices
recipe_directions.6: Add ghee for the flavours. Cover the pan with a lid and let the mutton cook in its own juices for about 30 to 45 minutes
recipe_directions.7: Half way through, sprinkle 1 big tablespoon freshly grounded garam masala. Once the mutton is tender, add some chopped coriander, lime juice and serve hot
recipe_directions.8: Serve Himachali Mutton Rara along with hot steamed

recipe_ingredients.name: Coriander (Dhania) Leaves , Few sprigs, finely chopped

title: Mutton Akbari Recipe
author: NDTV Food
description:
Mutton Akbari Recipe: Mutton Akbari is a delicious mutton curry and you can make curry for lavish dinner.Total Cook Time 25 mins Prep Time 10 mins Cook Time 15 mins Recipe Servings2EasyIngredients of Mutton Akbari1 Tbsp Ghee  1 tbsp Oil Salt (as required)500 gram Mutton (cooked)1 tbsp Ginger-Garlic Paste2  Tomatoes 3  Green Chillies 3 tbsp Curd  1/2 tsp Turmeric Powder 1 tsp Chaat Masala Powder 1 tsp Black Pepper Powder 1 tsp Red Chilli Powder 1 tsp Garam Masala Powder1 tsp Red Chilli Flakes Water (as required)  Lemon JuiceHow to Make Mutton AkbariHideShow 
                                            Media
                                        1.Heat ghee in a pan, add boiled mutton, ginger garlic paste and season it with salt.  Fry the mutton till it brown.2.Add chopped tomatoes and green chilles. Once the tomatoes are nice and mushy, pour in the curd. keep stirring the curd to prevent it from curdling.3.Next, add turmeric powder, chat masala, pepper powder, red chilli powder, garam masala and red chillies flakes.4.Pour water and lemon juice. Cover the pan, once the gravy is combined, the dish is ready!Key Ingredients: Ghee  , Oil Salt (as required), Mutton (cooked), Ginger-Garlic Paste, Tomatoes , Green Chillies , Curd  , Turmeric Powder , Chaat Masala Powder , Black Pepper Powder , Red Chilli Powder , Garam Masala Powder, Red Chilli Flakes Water (as required), Lemon Juice
                                        Tags:
                                    MuttonAkbari5 Share Recipe Share Recipe Facebook
                 Twitter
                 Reddit
                 
                    Snapchat

recipe_directions.1: Heat ghee in a pan, add boiled mutton, ginger garlic paste and season it with salt.  Fry the mutton till it brown
recipe_directions.2: Add chopped tomatoes and green chilles. Once the tomatoes are nice and mushy, pour in the curd. keep stirring the curd to prevent it from curdling
recipe_directions.3: Next, add turmeric powder, chat masala, pepper powder, red chilli powder, garam masala and red chillies flakes
recipe_directions.4: Pour water and lemon juice. Cover the pan, once the gravy is combined, the dish is ready!

title: Badam Gosht Korma Recipe
author: NDTV Food
description:
Badam Gosht Korma  Recipe: This is a delicious curry which is made by almond, curd and whole spices. This curry is perfect for your next dinner party.Total Cook Time1 hr  Prep Time 15 mins Cook Time 45 mins Recipe Servings2EasyIngredients of Badam Gosht Korma1/2 Kg mutton1 cups almonds2 large onions chopped and fried crisp 4 tbsp curd4 tbsp ghee1 tbsp ginger-garlic paste 1 tbsp coriander powder1 tbsp red chili powder 1/2 tsp turmeric powder  Salt as required1  cinnamon stick2  bay leaves 4-5  green cardamom 1  black cardamom 3-4 drops   kewra/rose waterHow to Make Badam Gosht KormaHideShow 
                                            Media
                                        1.Wash and soak almonds in hot water for 10 minutes. Peel off the skin and take half the almonds and curd and make a fine paste. Keep it aside.2.In a pan add ghee and whole spices, once they start to splutter, add mutton and fry until the mutton has changed color.3.Now add ginger garlic paste and cook until the raw smell is gone.4.Once the ginger-garlic paste and mutton has mixed well, add coriander, cumin, red chili and turmeric powder, salt and mix well.5.After around 2 mins add the curd and almonds paste and cook until the masala starts leaving oil.6.Next add the crushed fried onions and mix well for some time. Once the masala looks cooked, add around 2cups water and leave it to simmer for almost 30 minutes in medium fame with the lid on.7.Check once if the mutton pieces are soft. Now add the remaining almonds and cook for 2 more minutes. End with adding either kewra or rose water and let it sit with the lid on for 2 minutes.8.Garnish with coriander leaves and serve hot.Key Ingredients: mutton, almonds, onions chopped and fried crisp , curd, ghee, ginger-garlic paste , coriander powder, red chili powder , turmeric powder, Salt as required, cinnamon stick, bay leaves , green cardamom , black cardamom ,  kewra/rose water
                                        Tags:
                                    BadamKorma5 Share Recipe Share Recipe Facebook
                 Twitter
                 Reddit
                 
                    Snapchat

recipe_directions.1: Wash and soak almonds in hot water for 10 minutes. Peel off the skin and take half the almonds and curd and make a fine paste. Keep it aside
recipe_directions.2: In a pan add ghee and whole spices, once they start to splutter, add mutton and fry until the mutton has changed color
recipe_directions.3: Now add ginger garlic paste and cook until the raw smell is gone
recipe_directions.4: Once the ginger-garlic paste and mutton has mixed well, add coriander, cumin, red chili and turmeric powder, salt and mix well
recipe_directions.5: After around 2 mins add the curd and almonds paste and cook until the masala starts leaving oil
recipe_directions.6: Next add the crushed fried onions and mix well for some time. Once the masala looks cooked, add around 2cups water and leave it to simmer for almost 30 minutes in medium fame with the lid on
recipe_directions.7: Check once if the mutton pieces are soft. Now add the remaining almonds and cook for 2 more minutes. End with adding either kewra or rose water and let it sit with the lid on for 2 minutes
recipe_directions.8: Garnish with coriander leaves and serve hot

recipe_ingredients.name: large onions chopped and fried crisp

title: Saag Gosht Recipe
author: Harangad Singh
description: Saag Gosht is lip-smacking curry of juicy and succulent mutton pieces cooked with coarsely pureed spinach and some aromatic spices. It is best served with chapati, naan or even tandoori roti. You can also pair it up with rice.

recipe_directions.1: Heat three tablespoons olive oil in a pan, add ginger, garlic and onion and sauté for two to three minutes
recipe_directions.2: Add mutton pieces and cook it for 3-4 mins or till the meat will be seared then add roughly chop mustard leaves
recipe_directions.3: Cover and cook it till mutton gets tender
recipe_directions.4: Add roughly chop spinach and stir
recipe_directions.5: Add chopped green chillies. Add salt to taste and stir well

title: Lahori Mutton Karahi Recipe
author: NDTV Food
description: Made in a thick gravy of tomato and onions, the dish is perfect to pair with some rich buttery naan or parathas.

recipe_directions.1: Wash and dry mutton chunks, add garlic paste and let it sit for some time
recipe_directions.2: In a karahi, heat oil and add cinnamon stick and cloves. Next add the mutton and fry for around 10 mins or until the colour has changed. Add ginger paste and chillies and keep frying
recipe_directions.3: Add coriander powder, red chilli powder and haldi, some salt and keep frying
recipe_directions.4: After the mutton is slightly cooked, add in the mix of tomato and onion puree and mix well. Keep cooking until the masala leaves oil
recipe_directions.5: Now add some water and cover and cook until soft and tender. Check for salt and adjust accordingly
recipe_directions.6: Take off the heat, garnish with ginger juliennes and serve hot

title: Keto Butter Chicken Recipe
author: Dr Shunmukha Priya
description: About keto butter chicken : This keto friendly butter chicken recipe is just the right thing if you want something healthy yet delicious. Here creamy gravy is subtly laced with chicken chunks and desi spices.

recipe_directions.1: In a bowl add turmeric Powder, Chilli Powder, Coriander powder and mix well
recipe_directions.2: Marinate the chicken in this powder and keep for 15 mins
recipe_directions.3: In a pan, heat the avocado oil, once it's hot, pan fry the chicken for 5 minutes on both sides till it gets fully cooked
recipe_directions.4: In a pan, heat the butter and on melting, add tomato puree and mix well. Add kasuri methi, water and cover with a lid and cook for 5 minutes
recipe_directions.5: Once tomato puree and oil get split, add heavy cream to this and mix well till everything has emulsified
recipe_directions.6: Add the prepared chicken to this, add pepper powder and salt, mix well and cover for a min on a low flame
recipe_directions.7: Garnish with chopped coriander leaves and serve with Rice /Roti

title: Nilgiri Turkey Korma Recipe
description: About Nilgiri Turkey Korma Recipe: A luscious, creamy turkey korma, made with a melange of spices along with coconut paste and curd.This is a perfect dish to prepare for your next dinner party!

recipe_directions.1: In a cooker, add turkey meat, salt, turmeric powder and water
recipe_directions.2: Cover with lid and boil it allowing 2 whistles. When the turkey is boiled then put it aside
recipe_directions.3: In a mixer jar, add spinach leaves, mint leaves, coriander leaves, green chilli, little water and grind it into a fine paste
recipe_directions.4: In a pan, add oil, then add shahi jeera, chopped onions, ginger garlic paste, and fry for 5 minutes
recipe_directions.5: Add boiled turkey meat pieces and mix well. Add fresh curry leaves and mix well. Cook for 10 minutes
recipe_directions.6: After 10 minutes, add coconut paste and mix well. Oil will ooze out
recipe_directions.7: Add curd, salt to taste, grounded spinach paste and mix well for 5 minutes. Fry until aromatic
recipe_directions.8: Add 1 glass of water and mix well, then add coriander powder and mix again
recipe_directions.9: Cover with lid to boil the turkey meat for 10 minutes
recipe_directions.10: After 10 minutes, open the lid and stir well
recipe_directions.11: When curry is almost done, add garam masala powder and stir. Add fresh coriander leaves, put in a serving bowl, and serve hot

title: Laal Maas Recipe
author: Ashish Roy
description: About Laal Maas Recipe: Laal Maas is a Rajasthani dish, fiery as ever, that you simply shouldn't miss! Here's a laal maas recipe packed with red chillies that you can try at home.

recipe_directions.1: Heat oil in a non-stick pressure cooker, to that add black cardamom, green cardamoms, cinnamon, cloves, whole mathania (red chilli) and bay leaf and sauté till its fragrant
recipe_directions.2: Add the onions and sauté till they turn light brown in colour. Then add the remaining ginger garlic paste and sauté for 5 minutes
recipe_directions.3: Add the lamb pieces to the onions and sauté on high heat for 10-15 minutes until the meat is seared properly
recipe_directions.4: Add turmeric powder, mathania (red chilly) paste, salt and sauté for 10 minutes
recipe_directions.5: Whisk the yoghurt and add into lamb and sauté on medium flame for 10 minutes, then keep it on simmer (slow flame) and let the mutton cook slowly.  Add little water or stock if required at any stage. Adjust seasoning
recipe_directions.6: Once the lamb is cooked, transfer to a serving bowl, garnish with coriander sprigs and a lemon wedge. Serve hot

title: Lauki Gosht Recipe
author: Mohammed Nafeesh - Courtyard Bengaluru Outer Ring Road
description: A delicious combination of Lauki and Mutton comes alive in the form of this spicy, aromatic dish of Lauki Gosht.

recipe_directions.1: Wash and peel the Lauki. Cut in to halves and wash and then keep a side
recipe_directions.2: Heat oil in a wok and add cinnamon stick, black cardamom and finely chopped onions, fry onions till golden brown
recipe_directions.3: Add the meat and sauté. Add ginger garlic paste and mix
recipe_directions.4: Add coriander, turmeric, red chilli powder along with salt and fry all of these spices
recipe_directions.5: Add chopped tomatoes and cook, followed by lauki and continue cooking with little water
recipe_directions.6: Let it simmer until the mutton is cooked
recipe_directions.7: Now add water depending on how thin you want the gravy
recipe_directions.8: Serve garnished with fresh coriander leaves

title: Steamed Fish In Banana Leaves Recipe
author: NDTV Food
description: If you love seafood, this recipe will definitely make you crazy.  Besides, it is easy-to-make, delicious and very apt for serving on occasions like birthdays, anniversaries, get-togethers and other parties.

recipe_directions.1: We first need to marinate the fish. For this, take a bowl, add fish chunks, lemon juice and salt. Keep it aside for 10 mins atleast
recipe_directions.2: Now, take a grinder, add coconut, coriander leaves, green chillies, garlic and cumin seeds to a fine paste
recipe_directions.3: Once done, wash banana leaves and pat try them. Spread it on the kitchen’s slab and put the marinated fish on top of it. Now spread the paste over it
recipe_directions.4: Fold the banana leaves neatly and steam them in a steamer with plenty of hot water
